title: Government income support?
content:
do you receive income support from the government or do you have a full time job?[url=http://www.ironmaiden.com][img]http://i11.photobucket.com/albums/a199/rorie1983/ironmaiden.jpg[/img][/url]

title: Re: Government income support?
content:
Lets see...

NEITHER!

Dammit! Society isn't just workers and bludgers! Ever heard of a dishonest businessman?

Or students for that matter.

In our country you can work full time AND get government assistance!

A proud member of the Spleen Extinction society

[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v410/Gannalev/rcwn.png[/img]

"No one should be here."
-Levellord

title: Re: Government income support?
content:
Currently I'm waiting for my tax-return, does that count?-----------------
[img]http://www.geocities.com/anthalerero/pic/banner_eurovision.jpg[/img]

title: Tomato, Tarago
content:
Bludger? I'm no bludger. I'm a slacker. There's a difference. The government pays me well for my slacking at the moment. I'm "working" on replacing it with a less annoying income stream, but a full-time 'job' is not on the agenda. Cave assectatorem Ductoris Alacris

A concerned member of the Preservation of Endangered Spleens Society

[url=http://jimsoft.spatang.com/]JimSoft Lair[/url]

title: Re: Tomato, Tarago
content:
Yeah, there should be "neither". I'm not doing anything but neither receiving anything. It sucks if you're student and live with your folks -- if I know correctly (and it is probable that I don't) you can get only about 20 euros if you live home. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-offended.gif[/img] Well, haven't bothered filling some forms to get that. This is unfair!3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."
